original_title: Funérailles à Bongo: Le vieil Anaï, 1848–1971
overview: In 1972, the Dogon of the Bandiagara cliff in Mali celebrated the funeral of Anaï Dolo, head of the Bongo Masks Society, who died at the age of 122. On this occasion, the large Bongo mask, is erected and for twenty days, family members, elders, men from neighbouring villages purify the village.
title: Funeral at Bongo: Old Anaï, 1848–1971
